bibl.title: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 13, 1927

div1.p: Kibler informs Emilie Lawrence Reed that the dedication ceremony has been rescheduled.

div1.head: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 13, 1927
div1.opener:
P. O. Box 470,
Newport News, Virginia.
August 13, 1927.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Blue Ridge Summitt, Pa.
Dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Your second letter received. I will appreciate whatever data your son
has in his possession, however little it may be. It will hepl me in getting the proper
view-point for correctly “interpreting” any phase of the BELROI subject, as well as add
something to whatever I may get some-where else.

As Dr. Jones has deferred the date of dedication, (possibly he has so written
to youO) until October, I shall try to read the books you cite me to in your letters. I
will now have plenty of time to do more satisfactorily what I have in mind to give pub-
licity, generally, to the program ogf Dr. Jones's Commission. (Watch the Washington Star,
I'm a Free Lance on news of this character--a kind of “specialty” of mine; anything with
a background of history and public service I liket to write about.
I am enclosing clipping, which will interest you.
Thanking you for your helpful suggestions and information, I am,
